medical_history.chief_complaint: The infant was admitted with a diagnosis of bronchiolitis and developed violaceous skin lesions.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The skin lesions developed during admission, becoming ulcerated within 3 to 4 days, with areas of infarcted necrosis.
medical_history.family_history: The mother had a known hepatitis C virus infection and drug addiction. The pregnancy was unsupervised.
